headline_memory.headline: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit a record $74.6B on Dec 31 (year-end).
headline_memory.why_it_matters: Flags year-end funding tightness; normalization pace can affect front-end rates/liquidity tone.

headline_memory.headline: Germany Dec manufacturing PMI final 47.0, indicating deeper contraction; export sales fell sharply.
headline_memory.why_it_matters: Europe growth weakness can weigh global risk tone and support duration demand during risk-off episodes.

active_contexts.statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export sales a key drag.
active_contexts.market_link: EU manufacturing contraction can pressure global risk sentiment and support UST duration; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).
active_contexts.notes: Germany downturn linked to export-sales weakness.

active_contexts.statement: NY Fed standing repo operation usage hit a record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs.
active_contexts.market_link: Highlights calendar-driven funding tightness; focus is whether take-up normalizes post-turn for rates/liquidity tone.
active_contexts.notes: Reuters framing emphasizes year-end effects vs systemic stress.

active_contexts.statement: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); steady, slow-moving liquidity backdrop.
active_contexts.market_link: Secondary macro signal for EUR rates/FX; tends to matter for US futures mainly via EU risk/ECB repricing headlines.
active_contexts.notes: Keep as background; low immediate US impact absent broader EU shock.

watchlist.statement: US cash close (Jan 2): MOC buy imbalance S&P +1485.3M; NQ +330.8M; Dow +432.2M; Mag7 +273.3M.
watchlist.market_link: Large closing imbalances can create late-day futures dislocations and raise next-session gap sensitivity in ES/NQ.

watchlist.statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; in line with forecast and prior (low surprise).
watchlist.market_link: More sensitivity typically in prices/new orders details than a no-revision final; incremental vs ISM narrative.

watchlist.statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 vs flash 51.2; marginal expansion but softer than first read.
watchlist.market_link: UK/Europe growth tone can influence broad risk sentiment; usually modest direct impact on US index futures.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Any reaction-function framing can shift front-end pricing and spill into equity-duration sensitivity (ES/NQ) and USD (DX).

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: A second appearance can reinforce/clarify prior remarks; market focus tends to be inflation vs growth balance and policy-conditions language.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Meeting (Decision/Statement; press conference 2:30pm ET)
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Scheduled policy decision; reprices front-end expectations and can transmit to equity multiples and USD via real-rate moves.

change_log.reason: Revalidated record $74.6B take-up and year-end framing via Reuters; extended TTL modestly as post-turn normalization remains relevant.
Confirmed Germany final 47.0 and export-sales drag in Reuters Jan 2 report; maintained risk-tone linkage.
Dropped due to lack of fresh, confirmed catalyst in todayâ€™s inputs; avoids stale narrative without a new headline trigger.
Stored as sticky liquidity context around year-end funding dynamics; likely to matter for days as normalization is assessed.
Stored as sticky Europe growth headwind context; aligns with Reuters details on export-sales weakness.
